column1: Yemanzhelinsk (Russian: Еманжели́нск) is a town and the administrative center of Yemanzhelinsky District in Chelyabinsk Oblast
column3: located near the border with Kazakhstan on the eastern slopes of the Southern Ural Mountains
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 30

column1: Founded in 1770 as a Cossack village
column2: it has been known as the stanitsa of Yemanzhelinskaya (Еманжелинская) since 1866. It became a coal mining settlement in 1930–1931
column3: which was granted town status on September 25
column4: 1951.. It was one of the places closest to the hypocenter of the blast from the 2013 Russian meteor event.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Yemanzhelinsk serves as the administrative center of Yemanzhelinsky District. As an administrative division
column5: incorporated within Yemanzhelinsky District as the Town of Yemanzhelinsk. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Yemanzhelinsk is incorporated within Yemanzhelinsky Municipal District as Yemanzhelinskoye Urban Settlement.
